comments:
I tried downloading Eclipse 3.0.2, along with some other updates available at 
your site (EMF, GDT, Visual Editors).  On completion of the download, I was 
informed that I needed to shutdown the platform and restart.  When I did that 
I was greeted with a popup message "An error has occurred. See the log file 
c:\Dev\Eclipse\configuration\nnnnnnnnnn.log".  After reading the log file, 
which said that there was an "ID" missing, I thought that maybe my "MyEclipse" 
installation had gotten in the way somehow.  However, when I uninstalled 
MyEclipse, Eclipse just gave me the same error message.  I've included the 
contents of the latest version of the log file below.

Clearly this is a very serious problem: I can't even start my Eclipse program 
in order to revert to my previous version, which was 3.0.1.  It looks like I 
will have to completely reinstall my Eclipse, along with all of the other plug-
ins I have added over time.  Sorry, but this is simply not acceptable!

David McLeod

-----------------  LOG FILE ATTACHED HERE --------------

You've probably encountered "the bug" that was fixed in 3.0.1.1 (and 3.0.2 as 
well).
This is unfortunate, but there is an easy workaround: do not uninstall 
anything, just get the eclipse sdk zip, unzip it on top, and restart eclipse 
with -clean.
